pull.title: rpc: Clarifying RPC getrawtransaction's time help text
pull.body:
#12339

The `time` and `blocktime` entries have the same value so they should have the same help text as well

events.body:
Concept ACK.

You have to rebase with master.

> Invalid push? Reset to [845d14c](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/commit/845d14cff70c5da741952c2395adbead263516a5)?

Yeah my bad
No need to rebase. Could just force push the already reviewed commit?

> No need to rebase. Could just force push the already reviewed commit?

I thought the same thing but @promag asked for a rebase
We had issues with travis earlier today, but it is possible to just reset a travis run without a rebase or otherwise touching the commit.
I did not know that, but good to know

rename.from: Clarifying RPC getrawtransaction's time help text
rename.to: rpc: Clarifying RPC getrawtransaction's time help text

issue.title: getrawtransaction: time = blocktime ?
issue.body:
Not sure if this is a bug or wanted behaviour:

getrawtransaction rpc:
`"  \"time\" : ttt,             (numeric) The transaction time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)\n"`  
 `"  \"blocktime\" : ttt         (numeric) The block time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)\n"`

TxToJSON:
`entry.push_back(Pair("time", pindex->GetBlockTime()));`
`entry.push_back(Pair("blocktime", pindex->GetBlockTime()));`

If you just read the help you would think `time` is the time the transaction entered the mempool (as show in the getmempoolentry rpc).

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -130,7 +130,7 @@ static UniValue getrawtransaction(const JSONRPCRequest& request)
             "  ],\n"
             "  \"blockhash\" : \"hash\",   (string) the block hash\n"
             "  \"confirmations\" : n,      (numeric) The confirmations\n"
-            "  \"time\" : ttt,             (numeric) The transaction time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)\n"
+            "  \"time\" : ttt,             (numeric) The block time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)\n"
             "  \"blocktime\" : ttt         (numeric) The block time in seconds since epoch (Jan 1 1970 GMT)\n"
